page.title: 03Changes in Warwick
page.content: The Warwick area has changed greatly in the last 40 years. 11 new schools have been built many to replace old Victorian buildings, together with 3 old peoples homes and 2 new medical centres. Part of the market square and adjacent areas have been pedestrianised making life more pleasant for shoppers, as also do the many new shops which have been built in the central area. A new police station has been built on the edge of Priory Park the site of the old police station now being occupied by a new local authority office building and car park. Recreation facilities have improved with a new swimming pool and childrens play-ground in St.Nicholas Park. There is also much new housing. However the old open air market is still held in the market square each Saturday.
